sentence.Network_en: 'Abracadabra,'said the conjuror as he pulled the rabbit from the hat.
sentence.Network_cn: 魔术师囗中念念有词, 把兔子从礼帽中掏了出来.

sentence.Network_en: The boys looked at the conjuror in silent wonder.
sentence.Network_cn: 孩子们目瞪口呆地看着那魔术师.

sentence.Network_en: The conjuror's magic delighted the children.
sentence.Network_cn: 魔术师的戏法逗乐了孩子们.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: partly from conjure, partly from Old French conjureor, conjurere, from medieval Latin conjurator, from Latin conjurare 'conspire' (see conjure)

means.word_mean: 1. someone who performs magic tricks to amuse an audience
2. a witch doctor who practices conjury

auth_sentence.content: Lewis Silkin, ever the stand-out Christmas conjuror, perseveres regardless in the spirit of seasonal inventiveness.
